value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.excerpt: In a previous video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o_Qh0SccyAc) I showed you how to write natural language narratives in Power BI. value.title: Row Level Security in Power BI desktop - Power BI Tips & Tricks #27
value.excerpt: In this video we will see how to add Row Level security to your Power BI data.  Row Level security is used to restrict data access for given users. Filters restrict data at the row level. You can define filters within roles. What is Row Level Security: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-rls/

value.title: Power BI Desktop Download or Microsoft Store App   Which One is better
value.excerpt: If you want to develop Power BI reports, you'll need the Power BI Desktop application. However, Power BI Desktop application comes in two ways; Download it separately and install it on your Windows machine, or Get it from Microsoft Store as an App. The question that I often get is; What is the difference?

value.title: The Best Way to Install Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Power BI Desktop is a free, standalone self service BI tool for data modelling and reporting.  You will not get a better, free desktop data modelling and reporting tool than this anywhere.   Power BI Desktop is evolving at a rapid rate with updates released every month. Due to the [...]Read More »

value.title: The Most Important Update to Power BI Desktop, Ever!
value.excerpt: The December 2020 version of Power BI desktop has just been released, and it is undoubtably the most important release since the first version way back in 2015. The super feature that has been released is an update to composite models using direct query of online datasets. The implications of [...]Read

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You’ll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you’ll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: 3 Best practices when transforming data in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, I go through the what I believe are best practices for cleaning your data in Power BI: 1. Rename your query steps 2. Change Data types to all columns 3.
